thread.title: Newswire: Kanye West is Jesus, and also somebody made a statue of Kanye West as Jesus
thread.title_full: Newswire: Kanye West is Jesus, and also somebody made a statue of Kanye West as Jesus

author: Sam Barsanti
title: Newswire: Kanye West is Jesus, and also somebody made a statue of Kanye West as Jesus
text:
(Photo: Getty Images, Drew Angerer) (Photo: Getty Images, Drew Angerer) Share Tweet 
Earlier today, a giant gold statue of Kanye West as Jesus in a crucifixion pose appeared on Hollywood Boulevard in Los Angeles, and though that may seem a little weird, here’s the weirdest part: West himself had nothing to do with it. According to The Hollywood Reporter , the statue is actually the work of a street artist known as Plastic Jesus who previously created a “a life-size Oscar statue snorting cocaine on all fours” and a second Oscar statue with a heroin needle in its arm that was apparently “inspired by the death of Philip Seymour Hoffman.” We’re not sure what the message was supposed to be with the last one other than “an award-winning actor died of a drug overdose,” but you’re never really supposed to understand street art anyway. My colleague @Jriefe on ground at installation of @kanyewest as Jesus by @plasticjesusart , here are new pics https://t.co/y6a78kCGaS pic.twitter.com/Z1JvwCqJ6b — Chris Gardner (@chrissgardner) February 22, 2017 
As for the Kanye West Jesus, Plastic Jesus says it’s titled “False Idol” and that it’s supposed to act as a warning to the public about how we idolize celebrities right up until they misstep, at which point we “crucify” them. He also claims that it’s supposed to be critical of West, but all Plastic Jesus really says about the guy who openly refers to himself as Yeezus is that he’s “clearly talented.” 
The Hollywood Reporter story doesn’t say how long “False Idol” will be up, but Plastic Jesus is planning to move it to an art show by February 25.
